member.name: T:UcanDotNET.USBcanServer
member.summary: USBcanServer is a wrapper class for using the USBCAN32.DLL with .NET programming languages such as Visual Basic .NET, Managed C++ and C#.

members.member:
Event occurs when at leas one CAN message has been received. Specifies the CAN channel which received CAN messages.
Call the method to receive the CAN messages.
Do not call any class method within an event handler to prevent dead locks.
)

Event occurs when the error status of a module has been changed. Specifies the CAN channel which status has been changed.
Call the method to receive the error status.
Do not call any class method within an event handler to prevent dead locks.
)

member.name: E:UcanDotNET.USBcanServer.ConnectEvent
member.summary: Event occurs when a new USB-CANmodul has been connected to the host.

remarks.para: Do not call any class method within an event handler to prevent dead locks.

member.name: E:UcanDotNET.USBcanServer.DisconnectEvent
member.summary: Event occurs when an USB-CANmodul has been disconnected from the host.

remarks.para: Do not call any class method within an event handler to prevent dead locks.

member.name: E:UcanDotNET.USBcanServer.FatalDisconnectEvent
member.summary: Event occurs when an USB-CANmodul has been disconnected from the host which was currently initialized.

remarks.para: No method can be called for this module.
Do not call any class method within an event handler to prevent dead locks.

member.name: M:UcanDotNET.USBcanServer.EnumerateHardware(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,UcanDotNET.USBcanServer.EnumDelegateCallback,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enumerates all devices which matches with the filter parameters for device number, serial number and product code.
member.param: [IN] lowest device number
[IN] highest device number
[IN] lowest serial number
[IN] highest serial number
[IN] lowest product code
[IN] highest product code
[IN] callback handler for controling the enumeration
[IN] set to True if already used devices also should be enumerated
member.returns: Array of class USBcanServer holding all found and initialized modules.
member.remarks: Already used devices cannot be initialized. They only are passed to the callback handler.

member.name: M:UcanDotNET.USBcanServer.ReadCanMsg(System.Byte@,UcanDotNET.USBcanServer.tCanMsgStruct[]@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads one or more CAN-messages from the buffer of the specified CAN channel.
member.param: [IN/OUT] Reference to a variable containing the CAN-Channel to read from (, or ). When USBCAN_CHANNEL_ANY was specified this referenced variable receives the CAN channel where the read CAN messages came from.
[OUT] Array of several CAN message structure (see structure ). This address must not be NULL.
[OUT] Reference to a variable that receives the number of read CAN messages.
member.remarks: This function writes the actual number of CAN messages that were read from the device to the referenced variable dwCount_p.

member.param: [IN] CAN-Channel, which is to be used ( or ).
[IN] Array of CAN message structure (see structure ).
[OUT] Reference to a variable for receiving the number of successfuly transmitted CAN messages.

item.description: Second data byte of the CAN message.

member.name: M:UcanDotNET.USBcanServer.GetCanErrorCounter(System.Byte,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Reads the current value of the error counters within the CAN controller.
member.param: [IN] CAN channel, to be used ( or ).

member.name: M:UcanDotNET.USBcanServer.SetTxTimeout(System.Byte,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the transmission timeout.
member.param: [IN] CAN channel, to be used ( or ).
[IN] transmit timeout in milleseconds (value 0 disables this feature).
member.remarks: NOTE: When a transmission timeout is set the firmware tries to send a message within this timeout. If it could not be sent the firmware sets the "auto delete" state. Within this state all transmit CAN messages for this channel will be deleted automatically for not blocking the other channel. When firmware does delete a transmit CAN message then a new error status will be set: USBCAN_CANERR_TXMSGLOST (red LED is blinking).

member.name: M:UcanDotNET.USBcanServer.SetDebugMode(System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function enables the creation of a debug log file out of the USBCAN-library. If this feature has already been activated via the USB-CANmodul Control, the content of the “old” log file will be copied to the new file. Further debug information will be appended to the new file.
member.param: [IN] debug level (bit format)
[IN] file path to debug log file
[IN] additional flags (bit0: file append mode)
member.returns: FALSE if logfile not created otherwise TRUE

member.name: M:UcanDotNET.USBcanServer.USBCAN_CALCULATE_AMR(System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates AMR using CAN-ID range as parameter.
member.param: [IN] if TRUE parameters from_id and to_id contains 29-bit CAN-ID.
[IN] first CAN-ID which should be received.
[IN] last CAN-ID which should be received.
[IN] if TRUE only RTR-Messages should be received, and rtr_too will be ignored.
[IN] if TRUE CAN data frames and RTR-Messages should be received.

remarks.para: This method only works if both dwFromId_p and dwToId_presults a successive order of bits.
Example:
from-id: 0x000 to-id: 0x01F --> method is working
from-id: 0x400 to-id: 0x4FF --> method is working
from-id: 0x101 to-id: 0x202 --> method is NOT working
The parameters fRtrOnly_p and fRtrToo_p will be ignored with all the modules of 3rd adn 4th generation.
